items.title: 'It was pandemonium': Jewish community in shock after deadly Bondi Beach attack
items.standfirst: At least 11 people were killed and more than two dozen injured in the attack, which targeted a Hanukkah celebration on Bondi Beach.
items.content: At least 11 people were killed and more than two dozen injured in the attack, which targeted a Hanukkah celebration on Bondi Beach.

items.title: Gunmen kill several at Jewish gathering in Sydney's Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: Two gunmen attacked a Hannukah celebration on a Sydney beach Sunday, killing at least 11 people in what Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called an act of antisemitism and terrorism. The massacre at one of Australia’s most popular and iconic beaches followed a wave of antisemitic attacks that have roiled the country over the past year, although the authorities didn’t suggest those episodes and Sunday’s shooting were connected.
items.content: Two gunmen attacked a Hannukah celebration on a Sydney beach Sunday, killing at least 11 people in what Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called an act of antisemitism and terrorism. The massacre at one of Australia’s most popular and iconic beaches followed a wave of antisemitic attacks that have roiled the country over the past year, although the authorities didn’t suggest those episodes and Sunday’s shooting were connected.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Rabbi killed at Jewish holiday gathering
items.standfirst: Hundreds had gathered Sunday to celebrate a Jewish holiday at Bondi Beach where a mass shooting was carried out earlier. The event was to mark the start of the eight-day Hanukkah festival. One of the victims of the shooting was identified as Rabbi Eli Schlanger, assistant rabbi at Chabad of Bondi and a key organizer of the event, by the Orthodox Jewish movement Chabad.
items.content: Hundreds had gathered Sunday to celebrate a Jewish holiday at Bondi Beach where a mass shooting was carried out earlier. The event was to mark the start of the eight-day Hanukkah festival. One of the victims of the shooting was identified as Rabbi Eli Schlanger, assistant rabbi at Chabad of Bondi and a key organizer of the event, by the Orthodox Jewish movement Chabad.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Explosive device found in vehicle linked to shooters
items.standfirst: Two gunmen shot dead at least 11 people on Sunday during a Jewish holiday celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Australian authorities said, declaring it a terrorist attack. One gunman was fatally shot by police and the second arrested. Reporting from Sydney, FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison said police authorities claimed to have found an explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the shooters. Harrison added that one of the suspects have been identified as Naveed Akram, who hails from southwest Sydney.
items.content: Two gunmen shot dead at least 11 people on Sunday during a Jewish holiday celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Australian authorities said, declaring it a terrorist attack. One gunman was fatally shot by police and the second arrested. Reporting from Sydney, FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison said police authorities claimed to have found an explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the shooters. Harrison added that one of the suspects have been identified as Naveed Akram, who hails from southwest Sydney.

items.title: Video appears to show moment Bondi Beach shooter is disarmed
items.standfirst: Video appears to show one of the shooters at Australia’s Bondi Beach being disarmed by a bystander. “That man is a genuine hero," New South Wales Premier Chris Minns said. At least 11 people were killed in the attack, which targeted the Jewish community and officials called an act of terrorism and antisemitism.
items.content: Video appears to show one of the shooters at Australia’s Bondi Beach being disarmed by a bystander. “That man is a genuine hero," New South Wales Premier Chris Minns said. At least 11 people were killed in the attack, which targeted the Jewish community and officials called an act of terrorism and antisemitism.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: One suspect in custody in critical condition
items.standfirst: At least 12 people were killed and almost 30 wounded when gunmen fired on a Jewish holiday event at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday in what Australian police and officials described as a terrorist attack. One suspected gunman was killed and another was in a critical condition, New South Wales Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon told a press conference. At least 29 people injured, including two police officers, were taken to hospital, he said. FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison reports from Sydney.
items.content: At least 12 people were killed and almost 30 wounded when gunmen fired on a Jewish holiday event at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday in what Australian police and officials described as a terrorist attack. One suspected gunman was killed and another was in a critical condition, New South Wales Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon told a press conference. At least 29 people injured, including two police officers, were taken to hospital, he said. FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison reports from Sydney.

items.title: Eyewitness captures moment man tackles and disarms Bondi shooter
items.standfirst: New South Wales Police say that 11 people were killed, plus one gunman, in a shooting at Bondi Beach targeting the Jewish community.
items.content: New South Wales Police say that 11 people were killed, plus one gunman, in a shooting at Bondi Beach targeting the Jewish community.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting a 'terrorist incident', New South Wales police force commissioner says
items.standfirst: New South Wales Police Force Commissioner Mal Lanyon said on Sunday that the Bondi Beach shooting was a “terrorist incident”. At least 12 people were killed and 29 wounded in the attack earlier in the day, he told a press conference.
items.content: New South Wales Police Force Commissioner Mal Lanyon said on Sunday that the Bondi Beach shooting was a “terrorist incident”. At least 12 people were killed and 29 wounded in the attack earlier in the day, he told a press conference.

items.title: Bystander disarms Bondi Beach gunman during mass shooting in Sydney

items.content: A bystander disarmed a gunman during a mass shooting at Sydney’s Bondi Beach that left multiple dead and injured.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting 'designed to target Sydney's Jewish community', New South Wales premier says
items.standfirst: The Bondi Beach shooting was "designed to target Sydney's Jewish community", New South Wales Premier Chris Minns said at a press conference on Sunday.
items.content: The Bondi Beach shooting was "designed to target Sydney's Jewish community", New South Wales Premier Chris Minns said at a press conference on Sunday.

items.title: At least 12 dead, including 1 gunman, in mass shooting at Hanukkah event on Sydney's Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.
items.content: Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.(Image credit: Mark Baker)

items.title: Israeli president condemns 'cruel attack on Jews' after shooting at Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: Israeli President Isaac Herzog condemned Sunday’s shooting in Sydney as a “cruel attack on Jews” and urged Australia to step up the fight against antisemitism. Ten people were killed and about a dozen wounded when gunmen opened fire during a Jewish holiday event at Bondi Beach, officials said. New South Wales police have not confirmed whether the Jewish community was targeted, FRANCE 24’s Richelle Harrison reported.
items.content: Israeli President Isaac Herzog condemned Sunday’s shooting in Sydney as a “cruel attack on Jews” and urged Australia to step up the fight against antisemitism. Ten people were killed and about a dozen wounded when gunmen opened fire during a Jewish holiday event at Bondi Beach, officials said. New South Wales police have not confirmed whether the Jewish community was targeted, FRANCE 24’s Richelle Harrison reported.

clusters.title: Brown University shooting: person of interest in custody is in his 20s, police chief confirms – latest updates
clusters.neutral_headline: What we know so far about the Brown University shooting

items.title: Brown University shooting: person of interest in custody is in his 20s, police chief confirms – latest updates
items.standfirst: Officials refuse to share name of person or details of arrest; Donald Trump says ‘Things can happen’ in comments shared by White HousePerson of interest detained in Brown University shooting that left two deadWhat we know so farBrown University students were told that all remaining classes and exams for the semester would be delayed after the shooting that killed two people and left several others injured.In a note to students, the university’s provost, Francis J Doyle III, said the decision was made “out of our profound concern for all students, faculty and staff on our campus”. He encouraged students and staff to focus on their safety and wellbeing.In the immediate aftermath of these devastating events, we recognize that learning and assessment are significantly hindered in the short term and that many students and others will wish to depart campus. Students are free to leave if they are able. Students who remain will have access to on-campus services and support.At this time, it is essential that we focus our efforts on providing care and support to the members of our community as we grapple with the sorrow, fear and anxiety that is impacting all of us right now. University leaders are committed to providing care and mobilizing resources to assist our community members through this difficult time. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials refuse to share name of person or details of arrest; Donald Trump says ‘Things can happen’ in comments shared by White HousePerson of interest detained in Brown University shooting that left two deadWhat we know so farBrown University students were told that all remaining classes and exams for the semester would be delayed after the shooting that killed two people and left several others injured.In a note to students, the university’s provost, Francis J Doyle III, said the decision was made “out of our profound concern for all students, faculty and staff on our campus”. He encouraged students and staff to focus on their safety and wellbeing.In the immediate aftermath of these devastating events, we recognize that learning and assessment are significantly hindered in the short term and that many students and others will wish to depart campus. Students are free to leave if they are able. Students who remain will have access to on-campus services and support.At this time, it is essential that we focus our efforts on providing care and support to the members of our community as we grapple with the sorrow, fear and anxiety that is impacting all of us right now. University leaders are committed to providing care and mobilizing resources to assist our community members through this difficult time. Continue reading...

items.title: Person of interest detained in Brown University shooting that left two dead
items.standfirst: Nine others injured in Saturday attack that occurred during finals in engineering building in Providence, Rhode IslandBrown University shooting – latest updatesA person of interest in the shooting that killed two people and wounded nine others at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, on Saturday has been detained, police have said.Col Oscar Perez – the Providence police force’s chief – confirmed at a news conference on Sunday that the person of interest was in their 20s. Perez did not provide many other details about the person, including whether that person was connected to Brown. Continue reading...
items.content: Nine others injured in Saturday attack that occurred during finals in engineering building in Providence, Rhode IslandBrown University shooting – latest updatesA person of interest in the shooting that killed two people and wounded nine others at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, on Saturday has been detained, police have said.Col Oscar Perez – the Providence police force’s chief – confirmed at a news conference on Sunday that the person of interest was in their 20s. Perez did not provide many other details about the person, including whether that person was connected to Brown. Continue reading...

items.title: Syrian who killed Americans was part of security forces, interior ministry says
items.standfirst: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was to have been fired for extremism. Two US troops and a civilian interpreter died in what the Syrian government described as a "terrorist attack" on Saturday, while Washington said it had been carried out by an Islamic State group (IS) militant who was then killed.
items.content: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was to have been fired for extremism. items.title: Israel says its military killed Hamas commander Raed Saed in Gaza City strike
items.standfirst: If Saed is dead he would be most senior militant to be killed since October ceasefire, in attack on car that reportedly left four deadThe senior Hamas commander Raed Saedhas been killed in a strike on a car in Gaza City, the Israeli military said on Saturday.The attack killed four people and wounded at least 25 others, according to Gaza health authorities. There was no immediate confirmation from Hamas or medics that Saed was among the dead. Continue reading...

clusters.title: 'Pressure works': Belarus opposition leader Tikhanovskaya reacts to release of political prisoners
clusters.neutral_headline: Belarus releases 123 prisoners including opposition leaders after US lifts sanctions

items.title: 'Pressure works': Belarus opposition leader Tikhanovskaya reacts to release of political prisoners
items.standfirst: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, the exiled Belarus opposition leader, spoke to FRANCE 24 about the release from jail of fellow protest leader Maria Kolesnikova and Nobel Prize winner Ales Bialiatski along with 121 other political prisoners. "Let's not forget that at least 1,200 political prisoners are still behind bars, people are still being arrested every day, families are still being terrorised and repression hasn't stopped. So, there is still a lot of work ahead of us," said the former presidential candidate who stood against Belarus strongman Alexander Lukashenko. Asked about US moves to lift sanctions on Minsk in return for the prisoners’ release, Tikhanovskaya thanked the Trump administration for its role in brokering the deal, while calling for further pressure on the Belarus government. She added: "Lukashenko released these people not because he became humane, but because he feels the pressure and he wants sanctions lifted."
items.content: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, the exiled Belarus opposition leader, spoke to FRANCE 24 about the release from jail of fellow protest leader Maria Kolesnikova and Nobel Prize winner Ales Bialiatski along with 121 other political prisoners. "Let's not forget that at least 1,200 political prisoners are still behind bars, people are still being arrested every day, families are still being terrorised and repression hasn't stopped. So, there is still a lot of work ahead of us," said the former presidential candidate who stood against Belarus strongman Alexander Lukashenko. Asked about US moves to lift sanctions on Minsk in return for the prisoners’ release, Tikhanovskaya thanked the Trump administration for its role in brokering the deal, while calling for further pressure on the Belarus government. She added: "Lukashenko released these people not because he became humane, but because he feels the pressure and he wants sanctions lifted."

items.title: Belarus releases 123 prisoners including opposition leaders after US lifts sanctions
items.standfirst: Nobel prize winner Ales Bialiatski and opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava among those freed after US talks with Alexander LukashenkoThe Belarusian president, Alexander Lukashenko, has freed 123 prisoners, including Nobel peace prize winner Ales Bialiatski and leading opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava, after the US lifted sanctions on Belarusian potash, a key export.The announcement came after two days of talks with an envoy of the US president, Donald Trump, the latest diplomatic push since the Trump administration started talks with the autocratic leader. Continue reading...
items.content: Nobel prize winner Ales Bialiatski and opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava among those freed after US talks with Alexander LukashenkoThe Belarusian president, Alexander Lukashenko, has freed 123 prisoners, including Nobel peace prize winner Ales Bialiatski and leading opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava, after the US lifted sanctions on Belarusian potash, a key export.The announcement came after two days of talks with an envoy of the US president, Donald Trump, the latest diplomatic push since the Trump administration started talks with the autocratic leader. Continue reading...

items.content: Belarus has pardoned 123 prisoners, including a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and a key opposition figure who challenged the presidential elections in 2020, in exchange for US sanctions relief.

items.title: Thailand denies Trump ceasefire claim as clashes with Cambodia continue at border
items.standfirst: Thai PM says military will keep fighting and Cambodia suspends border crossings as casualties riseThailand-Cambodia fighting explainedThailand’s caretaker prime minister has denied the existence of a ceasefire with Cambodia, despite Donald Trump announcing that both countries had agreed to halt fighting.As heavy clashes continued along the border between the two countries, Anutin Charnvirakul said on Saturday that Thailand had not agreed to a ceasefire with Cambodia and that its forces would continue fighting. Cambodia announced it had suspended all border crossings with Thailand. Continue reading...
items.content: Thai PM says military will keep fighting and Cambodia suspends border crossings as casualties riseThailand-Cambodia fighting explainedThailand’s caretaker prime minister has denied the existence of a ceasefire with Cambodia, despite Donald Trump announcing that both countries had agreed to halt fighting.As heavy clashes continued along the border between the two countries, Anutin Charnvirakul said on Saturday that Thailand had not agreed to a ceasefire with Cambodia and that its forces would continue fighting. Cambodia announced it had suspended all border crossings with Thailand. Continue reading...

items.title: Daily Mail owner secures funding for £500m takeover of Telegraph
items.standfirst: Details of financing structure to be reviewed by culture secretary and regulators before deal can proceedThe owner of the Daily Mail has secured funding for a £500m takeover of the Telegraph, in a crucial development that paves the way for the group to announce the terms of its acquisition on Monday.Lord Rothermere’s Daily Mail and General Trust (DMGT) has agreed to pay the sum in two instalments, according to weekend reports. An initial payment of £400m will be funded by an increase in the group’s debt with its longstanding lender NatWest and existing company cash. Continue reading...
items.content: Details of financing structure to be reviewed by culture secretary and regulators before deal can proceedThe owner of the Daily Mail has secured funding for a £500m takeover of the Telegraph, in a crucial development that paves the way for the group to announce the terms of its acquisition on Monday.Lord Rothermere’s Daily Mail and General Trust (DMGT) has agreed to pay the sum in two instalments, according to weekend reports. An initial payment of £400m will be funded by an increase in the group’s debt with its longstanding lender NatWest and existing company cash. Continue reading...

items.title: Don’t use ‘boilerplate’ reasons to justify big executive pay rises, UK firms warned
items.standfirst: Investment Association, influential group of shareholders, urges pay committees to avoid ‘benchmarking’The UK’s largest listed companies have been warned against using “boilerplate” arguments to justify big executive pay increases by an influential group of shareholders.The Investment Association (IA) – whose members manage £10tn of assets – has told pay committees to avoid “benchmarking”: where companies argue higher pay is needed in order to match rivals and avoid bosses jumping ship for larger salaries and bonuses elsewhere. Continue reading...
items.content: Investment Association, influential group of shareholders, urges pay committees to avoid ‘benchmarking’The UK’s largest listed companies have been warned against using “boilerplate” arguments to justify big executive pay increases by an influential group of shareholders.The Investment Association (IA) – whose members manage £10tn of assets – has told pay committees to avoid “benchmarking”: where companies argue higher pay is needed in order to match rivals and avoid bosses jumping ship for larger salaries and bonuses elsewhere. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Far right eyes comeback as Chile holds presidential election
clusters.neutral_headline: Kast vs Jara: Chile votes in polarising presidential run-off

items.title: Far right eyes comeback as Chile holds presidential election
items.standfirst: Chileans began voting for a new president Sunday, making a stark choice between the most right-wing candidate in 35 years of democracy and the head of a leftist coalition. Polls show far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast as the strong front-runner in the runoff vote against his rival Jeannette Jara, a longstanding member of the Communist Party.
items.content: Chileans began voting for a new president Sunday, making a stark choice between the most right-wing candidate in 35 years of democracy and the head of a leftist coalition. Polls show far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast as the strong front-runner in the runoff vote against his rival Jeannette Jara, a longstanding member of the Communist Party.

items.title: Kast vs Jara: Chile votes in polarising presidential run-off
items.standfirst: Chileans cast their ballots in run-off election, with far-right candidate Jose Kast gaining ground in polls.
items.content: Chileans cast their ballots in run-off election, with far-right candidate Jose Kast gaining ground in polls.

items.title: UN condemns killing of Bangladeshi peacekeepers in Sudan drone attack
items.standfirst: UN says six Bangladesh peacekeepers were killed when a drone strike hit Sudan's central region of Kordofan.
items.content: UN says six Bangladesh peacekeepers were killed when a drone strike hit Sudan's central region of Kordofan.

items.title: Drone strike on UN facility in war-torn Sudan leaves six peacekeepers dead
items.standfirst: UN secretary general António Guterres says ‘unjustifiable’ attack on base in city of Kadugli ‘could be war crime’A drone strike has hit a United Nations peacekeeping logistics base in war-torn Sudan, killing six peacekeepers, the UN secretary general António Guterres has said.Eight other peacekeepers were wounded in the strike on Saturday in the city of Kadugli in the central region of Kordofan. All the victims are Bangladeshi nationals, serving in the UN interim security force for Abyei (Unisfa). Continue reading...
items.content: UN secretary general António Guterres says ‘unjustifiable’ attack on base in city of Kadugli ‘could be war crime’A drone strike has hit a United Nations peacekeeping logistics base in war-torn Sudan, killing six peacekeepers, the UN secretary general António Guterres has said.Eight other peacekeepers were wounded in the strike on Saturday in the city of Kadugli in the central region of Kordofan. All the victims are Bangladeshi nationals, serving in the UN interim security force for Abyei (Unisfa). Continue reading...

items.title: Lionel Messi’s India tour starts in chaos as angry fans throw seats in stadium
items.standfirst: Argentinian makes 20-minute appearance in KolkataSupporters climb fence and hurl objects from standsLionel Messi’s tour of India kicked off on a chaotic note on Saturday as fans ripped up seats and threw them towards the pitch after the Argentina and Inter Miami forward’s brief visit to the Salt Lake Stadium in Kolkata, the ANI news agency reported.Messi is in India as part of a tour during which he is scheduled to attend concerts, youth football clinics and a padel tournament, and launch charitable initiatives at events in Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi. Continue reading...
